intro: Psychotria malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. It is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
